etymology.description: 免(免) (miǎn, "exempt") and 费(費) (fèi, "fee") combined mean 'exempt from fee', indicating something is free of charge.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 免(免) (miǎn, "exempt") and 费(費) (fèi, "fee") clearly indicates the concept of not having to pay a fee. In contexts such as promotions or services, 免费(免費) (miǎnfèi) effectively communicates that there is no cost involved.

examples.chinese: 这家店提供免费饮料(這家店提供免費飲料)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn tígōng miǎnfèi yǐnliào.

examples.chinese: 网上购物时(網上購物時)，运费是免费的(運費是免費的)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎng shàng gòuwù shí, yùn fèi shì miǎnfèi de.
examples.english: When shopping online, shipping is free of charge.

examples.chinese: 参加讲座能享受免费咨询(參加講座能享受免費諮詢)。
examples.pinyin: Cānjiā jiǎngzuò néng xiǎngshòu miǎnfèi zīxún.
examples.english: Attending the lecture allows you to enjoy free consultation.
